title: Man City's Ilkay Gundogan on working his way back to fitness with Guardiola
text:
Sport Man City's Ilkay Gundogan on working his way back to fitness with Guardiola Manchester City's Â£20m summer signing has been out since last year when after he suffered cruciate ligament damage vs Watford. Ilkay Gundogan's start to his Man City career hasn't gone to plan after an injury in December left him sidelined for the rest of the season. 
Not one to be deterred the German has been working hard on his recovery and after watching City from the stands believes they can still beat Chelsea to the league title . 
Speaking to Eurosport the 26-year-old said: "Before the season had really started for me, it was already over again. That was terribly disappointing." 
Since his injury he has had an operation and has been working on getting himself back to full fitness. 
He explained: "I know I have to work really hard on my comeback. 
"Intensive work and pain are part of everyday life." 
Having watched City from the stands Gundogan believes that the Blues can close the eight point gap on league leaders Chelsea. Read More Man City's Ilkay Gundogan completes his first stage of recovery 
He said: "Eight points behind Chelsea seems difficult to catch up, but in England everything is possible. 
"The entire season feels like a roller coaster ride. We started very well, almost record-breaking. Then followed a low. 
"In the past games, we have grown again, although we have not always played well." 
Pep Guardiola is in daily contact with the midfielder as he continues with his rehabilitation back in Manchester after a spell in Barcelona following his operation. 
He explained: "We see each other almost every day on the training ground. I work there with full concentration on my comeback. We both often talk to each other - but not just about the injury, which is quite good."
